snippet: For the New York Police Department, the surge in violence presents an early field test for Commissioner William J. Bratton’s hands-off approach to local commanders.
abstract: Surge in killings in the North Bronx presents an early field test for New York City Police Commissioner William J Bratton's hands-off approach to local commanders; in an experiment in the 47th Precinct, every patrol officer, on foot or in cars, will begin making contact with a family on every block in the precinct, and Bratton has proposed giving more local control over when and how crime hot spots are flooded with officers.
lead_paragraph: For the New York Police Department, the surge in violence presents an early field test for Commissioner William J. Bratton’s hands-off approach to local commanders.

headline.main: Killings Surge in North Bronx, Testing New Police Tactics
headline.print_headline: Killings Surge in North Bronx, Testing New Police Tactics
